tasks.task: Raise a scythe from the ground
subtasks: Bend down to pick up the scythe
Lift the scythe with one hand
Stand up and hold the scythe upright

tasks.task: Push a lever to disengage an implement on a tractor
subtasks: Locate the lever on the tractor console or cab
Reach forward with one hand to grip the lever
Apply downward force to push the lever
Maintain pressure until the implement is disengaged

tasks.task: Drive a farm tractor up and down rows in a field
subtasks: Sit in the tractor seat with both feet on pedals
Operate the steering wheel to turn the tractor
Use the clutch and accelerator pedals to control speed and stopping

tasks.task: Hold a tarp over a load on a trailer
subtasks: Approach the trailer with the tarp
Unfold the tarp and cover the load
Secure the tarp with ropes or ties

tasks.task: Check the oil level in a tractor's engine
subtasks: Locate the oil dipstick on the engine
Pull out the dipstick and wipe it clean
Reinsert the dipstick fully
Pull out again to check the oil level against the marks

tasks.task: Use a handheld tool to clean hay or straw off a floor or surface
subtasks: Pick up the tool (e.g., brush, rake)
Scrape or brush away the debris
Dispose of the collected hay or straw

tasks.task: Properly store a brush that was used to clean a tractor
subtasks: Retrieve the dirty brush from the field
Walk to the designated cleaning area (e.g., wash bay)
Rinse the brush under a hose or immersing it in a bucket
Hang the brush to dry or set it aside until laundry day
Make sure bristles don't face upwards to prevent dirt collection

tasks.task: Stir a mixture in a large container
subtasks: Position next to the container
Dip a scoop or stick into the mixture
Mix the contents by rotating or scraping the sides
Broadcast the contents evenly, if necessary

tasks.task: Stroll around a field with a notebook or clipboard
subtasks: Walk along the rows of crops
Take notes or mark locations of plants or soil conditions
Ensure an even pace to cover the entire area

tasks.task: Shift gears on a four-wheel drive agricultural vehicle
subtasks: Determine if in 4WD or 2WD mode
If shifting to 2WD, press the 4WD discharge or disconnect lever
Confirm the gears have shifted
Shift back into 4WD when terrain requires increased traction

tasks.task: Conduct a field inspection on a tractor (checking belts, battery, etc.)
subtasks: Approach the tractor and access the underside or engine area
Inspect the drive belts for wear or fraying
Examine the battery terminals for corrosion
Tighten any loose bolts or connections
Lubricate moving parts as needed
Check fluid levels including coolant, brake fluid, etc.

tasks.task: Use a tic tac holder on a tractor seat for tools or items
subtasks: Locate the tic tac holder, which is typically a clip or loop
Attach a tool or clipboard to the holder
Adjust the item to within reach while seated
Use securely to avoid dropping during operation

tasks.task: Secure a cover (probably a tarp) on a hay baler
subtasks: Position the cover over the baler's discharge area
Wrap the length around the baler
Pin the cover in place with clamps or straps on the tractor
Ensure the cover is taut and secure to prevent hay from spilling

tasks.task: Drive a key into a lock to open a gate
subtasks: Position next to the gate mechanism
Insert the key into the lock mechanism
Rotate the key to the correct position
Push or pull the gate to verify it opens
Lock the gate again after access is complete

tasks.task: Disengage an implement from a tractor
subtasks: Determine which implement is to be disengaged
Move to the implement's attachment point on the tractor (usually front or rear)
Operate the hydraulic lever or mechanical link to release the implement
Lift the implement manually if needed (e.g., tailgate on a trailer)
Secure the implement stably so it doesn't swing or move while moving away
Move any attached implements away from the field if needed

tasks.task: Interface with a CNC machine to load or unload materials
subtasks: Approach the CNC machine's control panel
Use the joystick or buttons to move the machine's arm or head
Load material into the machine's feed area
Unload the processed material from the machine

tasks.task: Drive a tractor over uneven terrain
subtasks: Ride in the tractor seat
Monitor the ground for dips or bumps
Adjust speed and steering continuously to maintain control
Use the speed brakes if necessary

tasks.task: Position a tailgate on a trailer to block hay from falling out
subtasks: Approach the trailer's tailgate
Fold or lower the tailgate to the correct position
Secure it with straps or chains if needed
Ensure the gate is fully closed to prevent hay loss

tasks.task: Carve a path through a field with a scythe
subtasks: Stand in the path's edge
Swing the scythe back and forth to cut the vegetation
Move step by step through the field, cutting along the desired line

tasks.task: Face and position a loader on a tractor for pickup or dumping
subtasks: Align the loader’s forks with the cart or hay stack
Adjust the lift height smoothly without damaging the load
Winch or level the loader arms to maintain stability

tasks.task: Watch fields for signs of crop stress or pests
subtasks: Walk around various crop rows
Observe leaves, stems, and soil for abnormalities
Note areas needing closer inspection

tasks.task: Adjust the implements on a tractor to optimize the cutting or handling of hay
subtasks: Look at the current setup of the mower or baler
Make manual adjustments (e.g., setting height, angle) based on field conditions
Verify that the implement is functioning correctly after adjustment
Repeat as necessary throughout the day

tasks.task: Install a new battery in a tractor
subtasks: Open the battery compartment to remove old battery
Remove the old battery connections
Clean the terminals and post holes
Install the new battery and reattach the cables
Test the new battery's charge

tasks.task: Operate a mechanical loader to lift bales
subtasks: Approach the hay bales
Position the loader's forks underneath a bale
Lift the bale into the loader's forks
Transport the bale to its destination (e.g., stacking, moving to a trailer)
Lower the bale carefully without dropping it

tasks.task: Pick up a new implement and attach it to a tractor
subtasks: Carry the implement from its storage location
Align the implement with the tractor’s hitch point
Lower the implement and secure it using pins or hydraulics
Tighten tension straps if present
Test the attachment by attempting to move the implement
Check clearance around the tractor and implement

tasks.task: Properly park a tractor with a trailer in a shed or barn
subtasks: Drive the trailer into the designated area
Secure the trailer with tie-down ropes or chains
Block wheels for added stability
Turn off the engine and engage the parking brake

tasks.task: Adjust the throttle on a tractor to manage speed
subtasks: Identify the throttle control, typically a hand grip
Press or twist the throttle to accelerate or decelerate
Maintain the desired speed during operation

tasks.task: Use a hoe to weed around plants in the field
subtasks: Bend down to reach the weeds
Insert the hoe into the soil next to the plant
Push the hoe forward to slice through the roots
Remove the weed from the soil
Dispose of the weed or place it in a pile

tasks.task: Position a laydown wagon in a field to collect hay
subtasks: Drive the wagon to the hay shedding area
Fine-tune the position using the wheels or mechanical lift
Ensure the wagon is level and secure
Extend the collection chute or flail bars as needed

tasks.task: Watch over farmhands working around machinery
subtasks: Walk the field to check on the progress and safety
Look for proper use of personal protective equipment (PPE)
Provide instructions or coaching if needed

tasks.task: Collect and place saddle covers on a horse-drawn vehicle
subtasks: Untie the current covers from the vehicle
Dust them off and check for wear
Reattach the covers to the cart, ensuring they are secure
Ensure the straps are fastened tightly
Leading the horse if required, but not wearing the task related to the transcript.

tasks.task: Remove a broken attachment from a tractor
subtasks: Identify the broken part (e.g., a plow, disc, etc.)
Secure the tractor to prevent it from moving (e.g., using wheel wedges)
Use the hydraulic system to lift the attachment off the tractor
Disconnect any electrical or hydraulic lines to the attachment

Store the broken part properly, maybe in a toolbox. This is only if the transcript involves working with farm mechanized equipment, otherwise, this task would not be included here.
